channel.title: Welcome to ISNET on ISNET Series Website
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to ISNET on ISNET Series Website

item.title: Schools
item.description: This page links to schools and training courses and their resources. Learning from Data: Bayesian Methods and Machine Learning. This links to a course webpage and github repository for a Nuclear TALENT (Training in Low Energy Nuclear Theory) course held at the University of York in York, UK from June 10 to 28, 2019

item.title: ISNET meetings
item.description: The ISNET series of international meetings started in 2012 with a one-day workshop in Krakow, Poland and has been held since in both Europe and the United States. See this editorial in the Journal of Physics G and this article in Nuclear Physics News on the first ISNET workshop in Krakow. Upcoming meetings 2023: to be announced Past meetings 2021: [hybrid meeting:] Information and Statistics in Nuclear Experiment and Theory 9 hosted by Michigan State University from December 14th-16th.

item.title: Related meetings
item.description: This pages lists meetings related to the ISNET series, with links to talks and other resources if available. Meetings in 2020 Uncertainties in Calculations of Nuclear Reactions of Astrophysical Interest A virtual workshop was hosted by the Mainz Institute for Theoretical Physics. Available talks can be found on the timetable page. Artificial Intelligence for Nuclear Physics 2020 A three-day workshop entitled “A.I. for Nuclear Physics” was held in 2020 at Jefferson Lab in Newport News, VA, USA.

item.title: JPhysG Special Issues
item.description: The Journal of Physics G: Nuclear and Particle Physics from IOP publishing has an ongoing history of special issues focused on ISNET. 2015: Enhancing the interaction between nuclear experiment and theory through information and statistics (ISNET) 2019: Focus on further enhancing the interaction between nuclear experiment and theory through information and statistics (ISNET 2.0)
